entry.div:
Molders
from
Foix
Those who mold crosswise
make their
sand
with
crocum
&
calcined slate
, but
slate
always retains its asperity & becomes porous, because it is fatty.
En noyau
, it is not good; in
sand
, it can be accommodated. They
sieve
their
sand
, grind it on
porphyry
, and wet it in
water
, & they take away the finest, which is on top, then reheat it.
